org.forgerock.openig.io

Class MemoryBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openig.io.MemoryBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Buffer

    public class MemoryBuffer
extends Object
implements Buffer
    A buffer that uses a byte array for data storage. The byte array starts at a prescribed initial length, and grows exponentially up to the prescribed limit.

    Note: This implementation is not synchronized. If multiple threads access a buffer concurrently, threads that append to the buffer should synchronize on the instance of this object.

      MemoryBuffer(int initial, int limit)
      Constructs a new memory buffer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemoryBuffer

        public MemoryBuffer(int initial,
            int limit)
        Constructs a new memory buffer.
        Parameters:
        initial - the initial size of the byte array to create.
        limit - the buffer length limit, after which an OverflowException will be thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read(int pos,
       byte[] b,
       int off,
       int len)
         throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Reads up to len bytes of data from the buffer into an array of bytes. An attempt is made to read as many as len bytes, but a smaller number may be read. The number of bytes actually read is returned as an integer.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Buffer
        Parameters:
        pos - the offset position, measured in bytes from the beginning of the buffer, at which to read the data.
        b - the array of bytes to write the data to.
        off - the start offset in the array at which the data is written.
        len - the maximum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read into the array, or -1 if there is no more data.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.

      • append

        public void append(byte[] b,
          int off,
          int len)
            throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Appends len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to the end of the buffer.
        Specified by:
        append in interface Buffer
        Parameters:
        b - the array of bytes to read the data from.
        off - the start offset in the array at which the data is read.
        len - the number of bytes to be appended to the buffer.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs.
        OverflowException - if appending len bytes to the buffer would exceed its limit.

      • length

        Description copied from interface: Buffer

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the length of the file, measured in bytes.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Closes the buffer and releases any system resources associated with it. A closed buffer cannot perform input or output operations and cannot be reopened.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
